chargeHist.descr: Strangulation and Suffocation (with a Previous Conviction)
Strangulation and Suffocation (with a Previous Conviction)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Roosevelt J. Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation (with a Previous Conviction) [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident, Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment in an occupation acceptable to his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers, or be where illegal drugs are used or sold.  

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located, except for purposes of employment only.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other means, with the victim or her residence.  

Not to cohabitate with, or have any romantic resationships, unless his agent approves.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend and successfully complete domestic violence counseling/programming.  Attend and successfully complete domestic violence court.

records.addlTxt: Recorded by FTR.  DV court.  Court reviewed his discharge application.  Discharged from the DV Court program.

DV court.  Petition for discharge presented to the court.  Court concerned.  Petition is very surface.  Need to put more thought into the petition.  Go over #4 and 5 again.  Come up with 5 specific things to avoid domestics in the future, avoid coming back to DV court again.  Bring back next DV court date.

Hearing recorded - DV Court
Has orientation with Ashley next week.  Judge Becker will address petition to graduate DV Court.

DV court.  Looking for a place to live.  Follow though with finding a place.  He is looking for work.  Either get a job or start community service by next Monday.  Let agent know about place to live so be sure it qualifies.
for Domestic Violence Court Jail Sanction
DV court.  Great disappointment in his conduct.  Lying to the team and his agent.  Sanction.  60 days starting now.  If you continue to lie, probation will likely be revoked.  Expect honesty.
DV Court.  Turned in application for apartment on Friday.  Follow up with them.  Doing good with B.G's class.  Final project 6/15.
DV Court.  Not going to move to the Buckeye rental.  Too much work to make it habital.  B.G's class discussed.
DV court.  He found a new possible residence.  Talk with agent about the place.  Doing good with B.G.'s class.
DV Court - Court states she's heard he's doing well.  He says he's doing "fantastic".  Will be applying for housing soon.  Court reminds him to let T.M. so she can check the property out.
DV Court - states he's doing fantastic and is employed at Ashley full-time.
DV court.  Doing well with B.G.'s class.  Housing discussed.
DV court.  Doing well.
DV court.  Agent having trouble getting information from Florida. Class going good with B.G.
DV court.  He is at the TLP.  Looking for an apartment.  Need to get approval from DOC.  Doing good with B.G.
DV court.  Has appointment with B.G.  Working at Ashley.  Doing what he needs to do.
DV Court.  Gerald Fox presiding.  Good start.  Started with B.G.

(Hearing recorded)  Per B.G. - defendant has not contacted him to set up appt. for intake.  Defendant states he wasn't aware of it.  Fox instructs him to go directly to B.G.'s office after court today and stay there until he's able to make an appointment.  Also, at next meeting with T.M., he is to go over the rules for DV Court.  DA Fox explains how DV Court works and what is expected.  Defendant is working at Ashley 2nd shift starting tomorrow.
destroyed FIDR

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Fredrickson.  Defendant plead guilty to amended count 1.  940.235(2) Class G felony, Domestic. No repeater enhancers. Victim notification complied with.  No restitution request.  Victim is present in court.  Court recited the amended charge and possible penalties.  Defendant understands.  Counts 2 and 3 to be dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Felony warnings given.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant signed, and understood.     Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea to the amended charge.  Court confirmed defendant's prior conviction.  Court found that that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and entered his plea.  Found guilty as plead to.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed.  Victim made a statement in court.  Joint recommendation for 5 years probation.  Conditions:  11 months jail.  No contact with victim.  DV programming and DV court.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Seek and maintain employment. Attorney Fredrickson requests the time defendant has spent in jail be applied to the probation condition.  State requests that time be credited if defendant is revoked.  315 days credit stipulated to.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 5 years probation.  Condition ordered:  12 months jail.  Credit 315 against that sentence.  Obtain and maintain employment in an occupation acceptable to agent.  No contact with the victim or her or residence.  No drugs, not to have contact with known drug dealers or users, or their residences.  Not to be where illegal drugs are used or sold.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located, unless for employment purposes only.  Attend and successfully complete Domestic Violence court.   Attend and successfully complete domestic violence counseling/programming.  Not to cohabitate with, or have a romantic relationship with any female, unless agent approves.  Court costs.   Submit DNA sample if not done.  No DNA surcharge.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Victim named in complaint.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request. If bond is posted he may maintain job at Casino but must abide by the no alcohol conditions.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared.  Motion for bond modification by Attorney Fredrickson.  Requests signature bond with same conditions as previously ordered.  State has concern of flight risk.  Court ordered $1,000 cash bond with same conditions as before.
for Review of Bond Conditions
